Diogo held the position until January 2010

she earned a master's degree in financial economics in 1992

in 1989, she was named national budget director
After the 1994 Mozambique elections

She served as Mozambique's minister of finance for five years, from 1999 to 2004
In February 2004, the prime minister of Mozambique, Pascoal Mocumbi, resigned his post
